page.title: 20Wolsingham Social Concerns
page.content: The future ofthe Durham Dales has been studied by the{County Council}and public meetings held.The{future}looks {bleak.Industry}is not attracted to this remote area;{tourism}can only create a limited number of jobs; forestry creates jobs at the expence of farming.The prospects for the children of Wolsingham are that they will have to leave the area to find secure employment.Those who have done this survey may not live here in the future. The survey was done by:_ 1{Class 1}of the{Junior School}with {Mr Anderson 2{Sister Stephen's Class}from{St {Anne's Convent School 3{2nd and 4th Year Pupils}from the {Comprehensive School,}directed by{Mr {Pallister}and{Dr Hopkinson.
